resources.string: • Arrange Views in rows or columns\n • By default orientation is horizontal\n • Specify the orientation using android:orientation

• Arrange the Views in tabular format
 • Rows are defined with TableRow layout
 • Each view/viewGroup in TableRow acts as column
 • No. of columns in a table will be defined by the row having most no. of columns
 • Width of a column is defined by the row with the widest cell/column
• Arrange Views relative to each other or its parent

• Used to block an area on the screen for a single item\n • By default each view is place in the top left corner of the layout\n • It can have multiple items and you can arrange them with margin or gravity

• Used to make the views scrollable
 • Only supports vertical scrolling
 • Never use ListView inside ScrollView
• Use SP only for fonts, as it takes user preference into consideration
